Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of a 60-Second Mindfulness-Based Video Exercise in Orthopaedic Practice

Participants.evidence: 125 patients with upper extremity injuries were randomized

Intervention.evidence: randomized to either a mindfulness-based video exercise or an attention placebo control (educational pamphlet)

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the effectiveness and feasibility of a 60-second personalized mindfulness-based video exercise in an orthopaedic setting.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was pain intensity measured by the Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) immediately post-intervention.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 125 patients were randomized and analyzed (mindfulness: 62, control: 63).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mindfulness group demonstrated improved pain intensity (mean difference: 0.46, 95% CI 0.12-0.80, p=0.008)
